page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: Farming has always been important in Orkney.At one time most of the people lived on small crofts but now there are fewer people and the farms are larger ( 130 acres is average ) and modern. Orkney{beef}is famous.It comes from the herds of Aberdeen Angus, Hereford, Charolais and other beef breeds. { Milk}is less important, but Orkney {cheese}is made and exported. { Sheep}numbers have increased, mainly Cheviots, though Orkney does have a unique local breed_the{North Ronaldsay which exists on seaweed for most of the year and which looks like a goat. { Barley}is the main grain,but in addition some{bere}( a primitive variety of barley ) is grown for use in bere bannocks. { Goats,hens,pigs,horses}and other animals are less important.
